title: Coin Outcomes
text: When you toss a pair of coins, there are two possible outcomes for each coin: heads or tails. Think about the number of possible outcomes for each coin and how they combine.

title: Independence
text: For each coin, you have $$2$$ outcomes: heads (H) or tails (T). You have two independent events (tossing each coin), so the total number of outcomes is the product of the outcomes for each coin.

title: Multiplication Principle
text: Since you are performing two independent actions (tossing two coins), and you're interested in all possible combinations of outcomes, you should use the Multiplication Principle. The total number of outcomes is the product of the number of outcomes for each coin.
